source.Title: Sequential Attention
source.Enhancement: Greedy subset selection for feature pruning
source.Background: Standard models process 'noise' data, wasting GPU cycles on non-predictive variables.
source.Impact: 30% faster inference; reduces cloud compute costs by roughly 25%.
source.Deep-Dive: Uses an 'Attention-as-a-Filter' layer that ranks input importance before the heavy matrix multiplication happens.

source.Title: 6A-MLIP Efficiency
source.Background: Calculating atomic interactions beyond a 6-angstrom radius is computationally redundant.
source.Impact: 2x faster simulation speed; allows material discovery on consumer-grade GPUs.
source.Deep-Dive: By focusing only on 'physically significant' neighbors, it reduces the complexity of molecular dynamics from cubic to near-linear.

source.Title: PARTs: Spatial Assemble
source.Background: Grid-based Vision Transformers (ViTs) lose structural coherence when objects are occluded or seen at extreme angles.
source.Impact: Maintains spatial coherence even under stylistic or structural changes where standard ViTs fail.
source.Deep-Dive: PARTs models how object components relate in continuous space rather than fixed pixel grids. This allows robots to recognize a 'chair' even if it's upside down or partially covered by a blanket.

source.Title: SequentialAttention++ (Block Sparse)
source.Background: Individual weight pruning is efficient but often requires specialized hardware that doesn't exist on standard consumer chips.
source.Impact: Enables 'hardware-friendly' sparsity that yields real-world speedups on standard CPUs/GPUs, not just theoretical ones.
source.Deep-Dive: The '++' update integrates differentiable pruning with combinatorial optimization to remove entire 'blocks' or channels of weights in a single training pass.

source.Title: DiffCATS (Causal Diffusion)
source.Background: Standard time-series generation captures 'patterns' but fails to capture 'cause-and-effect' (e.g., if A happens, B must follow).
source.Impact: Reduces 'logic drift' in predictive simulations; essential for high-stakes financial stress testing.
source.Deep-Dive: DiffCATS uses diffusion models to generate synthetic data that adheres to a predefined 'Causal Graph,' ensuring the synthetic data is physically and logically possible.

source.Title: GIST (Smart Sampling)
source.Industries: LLM Training, Computer Vision, Big Data
source.Background: Training on massive datasets is inefficient; random sampling misses 'rare' but critical data points, while utility-only sampling creates bias.
source.Impact: Guaranteed to find a data subset whose value is at least 50% of the absolute optimal solution (NP-Hard approximation).
source.Deep-Dive: The GIST algorithm provides a provable guarantee for selecting a subset that maximizes both data diversity and utility, preventing 'data saturation' in large-scale training.

source.Title: AGNNCert (Certified Defense)
source.Background: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) used in fraud detection are vulnerable to 'topology attacks' where a hacker adds fake edges to hide their trail.
source.Impact: First certified defense that guarantees a GNN's stability against subtle adversarial structural changes.
source.Deep-Dive: Uses a robust aggregation framework to prove that a model's output will not change unless a significant number of graph edges are altered.

source.Title: Graphiti (v2.0 Update)

source.Impact: Sub-200ms retrieval at scale; allows agents to reason about state changes over time (e.g., 'What was my budget before the raise?').
source.Deep-Dive: Introduces a bi-temporal data model that tracks both 'Occurrence Time' and 'Ingestion Time'. This version features the new Graphiti MCP Server, allowing it to act as a persistent memory layer for Claude and Cursor.

source.Title: Sequential Attention
source.Enhancement: Greedy Subset Selection for Attention Layers
source.Background: Standard models process all input features equally, wasting GPU cycles on 'noisy' or redundant data tokens.
source.Impact: 30% faster inference; enables frontier-level accuracy on mobile-grade hardware without full model quantization.
source.Deep-Dive: A subset selection algorithm that identifies the most 'information-dense' features before they hit the heavy matrix multiplication layers, creating a 'dynamic sieve' for model inputs.

source.Title: EVE Framework
source.Background: LLMs are prone to 'hallucination drift' during long-form generation because they don't validate facts mid-sentence.
source.Impact: Increases precision by 29% and F1-score by 31%; breaks the trade-off between coverage and accuracy.
source.Deep-Dive: EVE constrains generation to a structured pipeline that decomposes reasoning into three distinct phases: Extraction, Validation, and Enumeration before final synthesis.

source.Title: IAPO (Inference-Aware Prompt Optimization)
source.Background: Prompt optimization is usually 'strategy agnostic,' ignoring how the model will actually be sampled (e.g., Majority Voting).

source.Deep-Dive: Introduces a unified framework that jointly optimizes the prompt and the inference scale (Best-of-N) based on a specific 'inference budget' and task-specific objectives.

source.Title: Nested Learning Paradigm
source.Background: Models suffer from 'Catastrophic Forgetting' where new data overwrites old, essential knowledge during fine-tuning.
source.Impact: Eliminates catastrophic forgetting by treating the model as a set of nested optimization problems that update at different speeds.
source.Deep-Dive: Uses a 'Digital Neuroplasticity' approach where 'short-term' layers learn daily trends while 'long-term' anchor layers preserve core reasoning and logic.

source.Title: ΔBelief-RL
source.Enhancement: Intrinsic Credit Assignment via Internal Belief Changes
source.Background: Agents in long-horizon tasks often suffer from 'sparse rewards,' where they don't know if a mid-step action was actually helpful.
source.Impact: Smaller models (7B) using ΔBelief-RL outperform 100B+ general LLMs in information-seeking tasks.
source.Deep-Dive: Uses the agent's own 'internal belief change' as a dense, per-turn reward signal. It rewards the agent for actions that resolve its own uncertainty, enabling faster learning in complex environments.

source.Title: WarpGrep (Context RL)
source.Background: Feeding an entire codebase or legal file into an LLM causes 'Context Rot' and high token costs.
source.Impact: 5x faster retrieval; 50% reduction in token usage for long-context tasks.
source.Deep-Dive: A lightweight sub-agent trained via Reinforcement Learning to perform targeted 'grep/glob/read' calls, finding the exact line ranges needed to keep the main LLM's context clean.

relations.fact: WarpGrep is trained with Reinforcement Learning
WarpGrep is applicable in Software Engineering
WarpGrep is applicable in Legal Tech
WarpGrep is applicable in Research
LLM suffers from Context Rot
WarpGrep utilizes Sparse Retrieval
WarpGrep is composed of Sub-Agents
WarpGrep code is hosted on GitHub

source.Title: OpenAI Roadmap 2026 (Leaked White Paper)
source.Background: OpenAI recognizes that 'Memory' and 'System Access' are the ultimate moats against Google/Apple hardware dominance.
source.Impact: Signals a shift where apps become 'Headless APIs' and ChatGPT becomes the primary interface for all human-computer interaction.
source.Deep-Dive: Roadmap outlines 'AgentKit' (a visual workflow builder) and 'ChatKit' (embeddable UI) to move AI from a website into the system-level 'Context Layer' of a device.

source.Title: Graphiti v2.1 (OpenAI MCP Edition)
source.Background: Standard KGs treat all data as static, but agents need to understand state changes (e.g., 'I liked X last week, but I prefer Y now').
source.Impact: Reduces 'Context Hallucination' by 40% in long-term assistant roles; allows for 'Memory Forgetting' of expired rules.
source.Deep-Dive: Uses a bi-temporal model tracking both 'Occurrence Time' and 'Ingestion Time.' The new release includes a native MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for OpenAI's new agentic stack.

source.Title: FormalJudge Paradigm
source.Background: Agents often make 'hallucination-based' logic errors in multi-step workflows that simple LLM-as-a-Judge models miss.
source.Impact: Ensures 100% adherence to formal logic constraints in agentic task execution; critical for high-stakes banking/legal agents.
source.Deep-Dive: Combines the flexibility of neural networks with the rigidity of Symbolic Logic. FormalJudge acts as a 'Verifier Agent' that checks code/logic before any action is executed.

relations.fact: FormalJudge utilizes Neuro-Symbolic Agentic Oversight

source.Title: WarpGrep (Context RL)
source.Background: Feeding an entire codebase into an LLM context window causes 'Context Rot' and exorbitant token costs.
source.Impact: 5x faster retrieval; 50% reduction in token usage for long-context tasks (like legal discovery or coding).
source.Deep-Dive: A lightweight sub-agent trained via RL to perform targeted 'grep/glob/read' calls, finding the exact line ranges needed to keep the main LLM context 'clean'.
